intro: Braya alpina f. insignis, commonly known as the alpine rock白菜, is a low-growing perennial plant native to high-altitude regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, characterized by its small, cruciform flowers and capsule fruits. The plant typically has a basal rosette of fleshy, spoon-shaped leaves that are covered in fine hairs. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to cold, arid environments. Due to its unique morphology and habitat, it is often found in alpine tundra and mountainous regions.
